humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report provides the size of the largest tumor, which is 1.2 x 1.4 x 0.9 cm. This tumor size falls under the T1 category, which includes tumors that are 2 cm or less in size. The presence of ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) or the percentage of the tumor occupied by in situ component does not affect the T stage for invasive ductal carcinoma. Therefore, the T stage for this patient's cancer is T1.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that the tumor size is 1.2 x 1.4 x 0.9 cm. In the TNM staging system for cancer, T1 indicates a tumor size of 2 cm or less in greatest dimension. Therefore, the pathologic T stage for this patient's cancer is T1.
